name: bamboo pole production | bamboo pole | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24554/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 Kg of bamboo pole. Bamboo culm with a water content of u =80 % is used for the production of bamboo pole. The production takes place at a bamboo processing facility and includes technical drying to a final water content of u =20% and trimming of culms. For this material, bamboos residues were considered the fuel used for the drying process. The figures origin from mainly calculations and literature values.;The pole is derived directly from the bamboo culm and is usually trimmed to between 4 and 6 m and treated against fungi and pests using boric acid. Bamboo poles can be used directly for the construction of columns, beams, or struts and are also the main input for other bamboo-based construction materials (BBCM) (Vogtländer et al., 2010, Vogtländer et al., 2014).  This dataset was developed with the support of the International Organization for Bamboo and Rattan INBAR;Ref:;Vogtländer, J., P. van der Lugt, and H. Brezet, The sustainability of bamboo products for local and Western European applications. LCAs and land-use. Journal of Cleaner Production, 2010. 18(13): p. 1260-1269.;;Vogtländer, J.G., N.M. van der Velden, and P. van der Lugt, Carbon sequestration in LCA, a proposal for a new approach based on the global carbon cycle; cases on wood and on bamboo. Int. J. Life Cycle Assess., 2014. 19(1): p. 13-23.

From reception of bamboo culm and treatment products at processing facility

This activity ends with Bamboo Pole (u=20%) at the processing facility. The dataset includes the inputs drying, treatment, trimming processes, as far as they are available. The dataset includes infrastructure. Losses of boric acid to the environment are not included in the dataset. However, they are not expected to be significant.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/162:Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Air emissions resulting from on-site energy production, i.e. the combustion of bamboos residues were calculated based on the dataset “heat production, softwood chips from forest, at furnace 300kW, GLO”
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The dataset is mostly based on literature values and was developed with the support of the International Organization for Bamboo and Rattan INBAR

flow.name: bamboo pole
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/162:Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials

exchanges.description: Bamboo residues which are produced as a by-product are used as internal fuel for the required heat input (0.2419 MJ/ Kg of bamboo pole) for technical drying process. Emissions for the combustion of bamboo residues are approximated with the combustion of wood chips using the dataset “heat production, softwood chips from forest, at furnace 300kW”. Since the LHV of bamboo (19.27 MJ/Kg) and softwood wood chips (19.1 MJ/Kg) are very similar, the original value was scaled with the required heat input of 0.2419 MJ only. The efficiency of the heating system was assumed to be the same as in the original dataset

flow.name: Formaldehyde
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Considered as the most common and low impact treatment for bio-based products. The amount reflects the amount of boric acid that is actually absorbed by the poles. The treatment solution is kept in tanks where the poles are submerged, once the treatment is finished the poles are extracted and the solution is recovered

Since the LHV of bamboo (19.27 MJ/Kg) and softwood wood chips (19.1 MJ/Kg) are very similar, the original value was scaled with the required heat input of 0.2419 MJ only. The efficiency of the heating system was assumed to be the same as in the original dataset

flow.name: Acetaldehyde
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Refers to the by-product of the trimming process of panels and other products that require exact dimensions. An amount of 0.0302 Kg (corresponding to a dry mass of 0.016887 Kg) of the bamboo residues per Kg of bamboo pole is used for internal heat production and thus subtracted from the total amount
